meanings.definition: Easily seen or noticed; readily visible or observable.
meanings.sent1: The bright red car was conspicuous in the parking lot.
meanings.sent2: The large billboard was very conspicuous along the highway.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse wearing a top hat was quite conspicuous at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was as conspicuous as a neon sign in the quiet library.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm made the lesson on dinosaurs truly conspicuous.

meanings.definition: Attracting attention by being unusual or remarkable.
meanings.sent1: The magician's conspicuous hat drew everyone's eyes to the stage.
meanings.sent2: The rare flower was so conspicuous that everyone stopped to admire it.
meanings.sent3: The penguin wearing sunglasses was a truly conspicuous sight at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for juggling was as conspicuous as a shooting star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique painting style made her work truly conspicuous in the art world.

meanings.definition: Standing out so as to be clearly visible.
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse was a conspicuous landmark along the coast.
meanings.sent2: The tall mountain was the most conspicuous feature of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The cow wearing a tutu was a conspicuous presence in the field.
meanings.sent4: His kindness shone as conspicuously as a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The diamond necklace was so conspicuous that it caught everyone's eye at the party.
